text: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this POKéMON.
Name: Bulbasaur

text: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.
Name: Caterpie

text: A brutal POKéMON with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high speed tackles.
Name: Blastoise

text: Often hides in water to stalk unwary prey. For swimming fast, it moves its ears to maintain balance.
Name: Wartortle

text: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. Powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.
Name: Squirtle

text: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to cause forest fires unintentionally.
Name: Charizard

text: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the temperature to unbearably high levels.
Name: Charmeleon

text: Obviously prefers hot places. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.
Name: Charmander

text: The plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.
Name: Venusaur

text: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.
Name: Ivysaur

text: Very protective of its sprawling territorial area, this POKéMON will fiercely peck at any intruder.
Name: Pidgeotto

text: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as MAGIKARP.
Name: Pidgeot

text: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.
Name: Pidgey

text: Flies at high speed and attacks using its large venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail.
Name: Beedrill

text: Almost incapable of moving, this POKéMON can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators.
Name: Kakuna

text: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp venomous stinger on its head.
Name: Weedle

text: Able to conceal itself in shadows, it never appears before humans, so its very existence was the stuff of myth.
Name: Marshadow

text: This artificial Pokémon, constructed more than 500 years ago, can understand human speech but cannot itself speak.
Name: Magearna

text: Reminiscent of the Ultra Beasts, this life-form, apparently asleep underground, is thought to have come from another world in ancient times.
Name: Necrozma

text: It has gobbled mountains and swallowed whole buildings, according to reports. It’s one of the Ultra Beasts.
Name: Guzzlord

text: This Ultra Beast came from the Ultra Wormhole. It seems not to attack enemies on its own, but its sharp body is a dangerous weapon in itself.
Name: Kartana

text: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. Witnesses observed it flying across the sky at high speed.
Name: Celesteela

text: One of the mysterious life-forms known as Ultra Beasts. Astonishing electric shocks emanate from its entire body, according to witnesses.
Name: Xurkitree

text: One of the dangerous Ultra Beasts, it has been spotted running across the land at terrific speeds.
Name: Pheromosa

text: This Ultra Beast appeared from another world. It shows off its body, but whether that display is a boast or a threat remains unclear.
Name: Buzzwole

text: One of several mysterious Ultra Beasts. People on the street report observing those infested by it suddenly becoming violent.
Name: Nihilego

text: It is said to be a female evolution of Cosmog. When its third eye activates, away it flies to another world.
Name: Lunala

text: It is said to live in another world. The intense light it radiates from the surface of its body can make the darkest of nights light up like midday.
Name: Solgaleo

text: Motionless as if dead, its body is faintly warm to the touch. In the distant past, it was called the cocoon of the stars.
Name: Cosmoem

text: Its body is gaseous and frail. It slowly grows as it collects dust from the atmosphere.
Name: Cosmog

text: The dense fog it creates brings the downfall and destruction of its confused enemies. Ocean currents are the source of its energy.
Name: Tapu Fini

text: It pulls large trees up by the roots and swings them around. It causes vegetation to grow, and then it absorbs energy from the growth.
Name: Tapu Bulu

text: This guardian deity of Akala is guilelessly cruel. The fragrant aroma of flowers is the source of its energy.
Name: Tapu Lele

text: This guardian deity of Melemele is brimming with curiosity. It summons thunderclouds and stores their lightning inside its body.
Name: Tapu Koko

text: When it spots enemies, it threatens them by jingling the scales on its tail. Weak opponents will crack and flee in panic.
Name: Kommo-o

text: It leaps at its prey with a courageous shout. Its scaly punches tear its opponents to shreds.
Name: Hakamo-o

text: It expresses its feelings by smacking its scales. Metallic sounds echo through the tall mountains where Jangmo-o lives.
Name: Jangmo-o

text: Swinging its massive anchor, it can KO Wailord in a single blow. What appears to be green seaweed is actually its body.
Name: Dhelmise

text: It has a compassionate personality, but if it is angered, it completely destroys its surroundings with its intense breath.
Name: Drampa

text: When it unleashes its psychic power from the protuberance on its head, the grating sound of grinding teeth echoes through the area.
Name: Bruxish

text: Its actual appearance is unknown. A scholar who saw what was under its rag was overwhelmed by terror and died from the shock.
Name: Mimikyu

text: The spiny fur on its back is normally at rest. When this Pokémon becomes agitated, its fur stands on end and stabs into its attackers.
Name: Togedemaru

text: The shell on its back is chemically unstable and explodes violently if struck. The hole in its stomach is its weak point.
Name: Turtonator

text: It is born asleep, and it dies asleep. All its movements are apparently no more than the results of it tossing and turning in its dreams.
Name: Komala

text: Originally making its home in the ozone layer, it hurtles to the ground when the shell enclosing its body grows too heavy.
Name: Minior

text: Its trust in its partner is what awakens it. This Pokémon is capable of changing its type, a flexibility that is well displayed in battle.
Name: Silvally

text: The heavy control mask it wears suppresses its intrinsic capabilities. This Pokémon has some hidden special power.
Name: Type: Null

text: It lives in shallow seas, such as areas near a beach. It can eject its internal organs, which it uses to engulf its prey or battle enemies.
Name: Pyukumuku

text: Possessed people controlled by this Pokémon transformed its sand mound into a castle. As it evolved, its power to curse grew ever stronger.
Name: Palossand

text: Born from a sand mound playfully built by a child, this Pokémon embodies the grudges of the departed.
Name: Sandygast

text: With a flashing slash of its giant sharp claws, it cleaves seawater—or even air—right in two.
Name: Golisopod

text: This Pokémon is a coward. As it desperately dashes off, the flailing of its many legs leaves a sparkling clean path in its wake.
Name: Wimpod

text: They form groups of roughly 20 individuals. Their mutual bond is remarkable—they will never let down a comrade.
Name: Passimian

text: Known for its extreme intelligence, this Pokémon will look down on inexperienced Trainers, so it’s best suited to veteran Trainers.
Name: Oranguru

text: It attaches flowers to its highly nutritious vine. This revitalizes the flowers, and they give off an aromatic scent.
Name: Comfey

text: Its long, striking legs aren’t just for show but to be used to kick with skill. In victory, it shows off by kicking the defeated, laughing boisterously.
Name: Tsareena

text: The sepals on its head developed to protect its body. These are quite hard, so even if pecked by bird Pokémon, this Pokémon is totally fine.
Name: Steenee

text: A delectable aroma pours from its body. They are often swallowed whole by Toucannon lured by that wafting deliciousness.
Name: Bounsweet

text: This immensely dangerous Pokémon possesses overwhelming physical strength. Its habitat is generally off-limits.
Name: Bewear

text: Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry and flails about, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling.
Name: Stufful

text: For some reason, only females have been found. It creates a reverse harem of male Salandit that it lives with.
Name: Salazzle

text: It burns its bodily fluids to create a poisonous gas. When its enemies become disoriented from inhaling the gas, it attacks them.
Name: Salandit

text: Forests where Shiinotic live are treacherous to enter at night. People confused by its strange lights can never find their way home again.
Name: Shiinotic

text: It scatters spores that flicker and glow. Anyone seeing these lights falls into a deep slumber.
Name: Morelull

text: It requires a lot of effort to maintain Lurantis’s vivid coloring, but some collectors enjoy this work and treat it as their hobby.
Name: Lurantis

text: During the day, it sleeps and soaks up light. When night falls, it walks around looking for a safer place to sleep.
Name: Fomantis

text: It delivers headbutts with the water bubble on its head. Small Pokémon get sucked into the bubble, where they drown.
Name: Araquanid

text: It crawls onto the land in search of food. Its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its soft head.
Name: Dewpider

text: It spits a mud that provides resistance to both wind and rain, so the walls of old houses were often coated with it.
Name: Mudsdale

text: The mud stuck to Mudbray’s hooves enhances its grip and its powerful running gait.
Name: Mudbray

text: Toxapex crawls along the ocean floor on its 12 legs. It leaves a trail of Corsola bits scattered in its wake.
Name: Toxapex

text: It plunges the poison spike on its head into its prey. When the prey has weakened, Mareanie deals the finishing blow with its 10 tentacles.
Name: Mareanie

text: When it’s in trouble, its eyes moisten and begin to shine. The shining light attracts its comrades, and they stand together against their enemies.
Name: Wishiwashi

text: Its quick movements confuse its enemies. Well equipped with claws and fangs, it also uses the sharp rocks in its mane as weapons.
Name: Lycanroc

text: It’s considered to be a good Pokémon for beginners because of its friendliness, but its disposition grows rougher as it grows up.
Name: Rockruff

text: It rolls up pollen into puffs. It makes many different varieties, some used as food and others used in battle.
Name: Ribombee

text: It feeds on the nectar and pollen of flowers. Because it’s able to sense auras, it can identify which flowers are about to bloom.
Name: Cutiefly

text: It beats its wings together to create fire. As it moves in the steps of its beautiful dance, it bathes opponents in intense flames.
Name: Oricorio

text: It aimed for the top but got lost and ended up on a snowy mountain. Being forced to endure the cold, this Pokémon evolved and grew fur.
Name: Crabominable

text: It zips around, on sharp lookout for an opening. It concentrates electrical energy within its large jaws and uses it to zap its enemies.
Name: Vikavolt

text: While guarding its weak points with its pincers, it looks for an opening and unleashes punches. When it loses, it foams at the mouth and faints.
Name: Crabrawler

text: Its body is capable of storing electricity. On camping trips, people are grateful to have one around.
Name: Charjabug

text: Its strong jaw enables it to scrape trees and slurp out the sap. It normally lives underground.
Name: Grubbin

text: When it finds a trace of its prey, it patiently stakes out the location...but it’s always snoozing by nightfall.
Name: Gumshoos

text: With its sharp fangs, it will bite anything. It did not originally live in Alola but was imported from another region.
Name: Yungoos

text: When it battles, its beak heats up. The temperature can easily exceed 212 degrees Fahrenheit, causing severe burns when it hits.
Name: Toucannon

text: It eats berries and stores their seeds in its beak. When it encounters enemies or prey, it fires off all the seeds in a burst.
Name: Trumbeak

text: It can peck at a rate of 16 times a second to drill holes in trees. It uses the holes for food storage and for nesting.
Name: Pikipek

text: It controls its water balloons with song. The melody is learned from others of its kind and is passed down from one generation to the next.
Name: Primarina

text: A skillful dancer, it creates a sequence of water balloons as it dances, and briskly bombards its enemies.
Name: Brionne

text: This Pokémon snorts body fluids from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. It’s famous for being a hard worker.
Name: Popplio

text: This Pokémon has a violent, selfish disposition. If it’s not in the mood to listen, it will ignore its Trainer’s orders with complete nonchalance.
Name: Incineroar

text: At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever this Pokémon spits fire.
Name: Torracat

text: While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.
Name: Litten

text: It fires arrow quills from its wings with such precision, they can pierce a pebble at distances over a hundred yards.
Name: Decidueye

text: A bit of a dandy, it spends its free time preening its wings. Its preoccupation with any dirt on its plumage can leave it unable to battle.
Name: Dartrix

text: This wary Pokémon uses photosynthesis to store up energy during the day, while becoming active at night.
Name: Rowlet

text: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It’s said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.
Name: Volcanion

text: This troublemaker sends anything and everything to faraway places using its loop, which can warp space.
Name: Hoopa

text: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.
Name: Diancie

text: When the Kalos region’s ecosystem falls into disarray, it appears and reveals its secret power.
Name: Zygarde

text: When this legendary Pokémon’s wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.
Name: Yveltal

text: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.
Name: Xerneas

text: They fly around on moonless nights and attack careless prey. Nothing can beat them in a battle in the dark.
Name: Noivern

text: They live in pitch-black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.
Name: Noibat

text: Its ice-covered body is as hard as steel. Its cumbersome frame crushes anything that stands in its way.
Name: Avalugg

text: It blocks opponents’ attacks with the ice that shields its body. It uses cold air to repair any cracks with new ice.
Name: Bergmite

text: Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. Anyone who hears their song is cursed.
Name: Gourgeist

text: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.
Name: Pumpkaboo

text: It can control trees at will. It will trap people who harm the forest, so they can never leave.
Name: Trevenant

text: These Pokémon are created when spirits possess rotten tree stumps. They prefer to live in abandoned forests.
Name: Phantump

text: These key collectors threaten any attackers by fiercely jingling their keys at them.
Name: Klefki

text: This very friendly Dragon-type Pokémon will hug its beloved Trainer, leaving that Trainer covered in sticky slime.
Name: Goodra

text: It drives away opponents by excreting a sticky liquid that can dissolve anything. Its eyes devolved, so it can’t see anything.
Name: Sliggoo

text: The weakest Dragon-type Pokémon, it lives in damp, shady places, so its body doesn’t dry out.
Name: Goomy

text: Born from the temperatures and pressures deep underground, it fires beams from the stone in its head.
Name: Carbink

text: Its whiskers serve as antennas. By sending and receiving electrical waves, it can communicate with others over vast distances.
Name: Dedenne

text: Although its body is small, its proficient fighting skills enable it to keep up with big bruisers like Machamp and Hariyama.
Name: Hawlucha

text: It sends a soothing aura from its ribbonlike feelers to calm fights.
Name: Sylveon

text: The diamond-shaped crystals on its body expel air as cold as -240 degrees Fahrenheit, surrounding its enemies and encasing them in ice.
Name: Aurorus

text: This ancient Pokémon was restored from part of its body that had been frozen in ice for over 100 million years.
Name: Amaura

text: Thanks to its gargantuan jaws, which could shred thick metal plates as if they were paper, it was invincible in the ancient world it once inhabited.
Name: Tyrantrum

text: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. If something happens that it doesn’t like, it throws a tantrum and runs wild.
Name: Tyrunt

text: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.
Name: Helioptile

text: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.
Name: Heliolisk

text: They knock down flying prey by firing compressed water from their massive claws like shooting a pistol.
Name: Clauncher

text: Their enormous claws launch cannonballs of water powerful enough to pierce tanker hulls.
Name: Clawitzer

text: Their poison is strong enough to eat through the hull of a tanker, and they spit it indiscriminately at anything that enters their territory.
Name: Dragalge

text: Camouflaged as rotten kelp, they spray liquid poison on prey that approaches unawares and then finish it off.
Name: Skrelp

text: When they evolve, two Binacle multiply into seven. They fight with the power of seven Binacle.
Name: Barbaracle

text: Two Binacle live together on one rock. When they fight, one of them will move to a different rock.
Name: Binacle

text: It wields the most compelling hypnotic powers of any Pokémon, and it forces others to do whatever it wants.
Name: Malamar

text: Opponents who stare at the flashing of the light-emitting spots on its body become dazed and lose their will to fight.
Name: Inkay

text: It can distinguish the faintest of scents. It puts its sensitive sense of smell to use by helping pastry chefs in their work.
Name: Slurpuff

text: To entangle its opponents in battle, it extrudes white threads as sweet and sticky as cotton candy.
Name: Swirlix

text: It devises various scents, pleasant and unpleasant, and emits scents that its enemies dislike in order to gain an edge in battle.
Name: Aromatisse

text: Generations of kings were attended by these Pokémon, which used their spectral power to manipulate and control people and Pokémon.
Name: Aegislash

text: It emits a scent that enraptures those who smell it. This fragrance changes depending on what it has eaten.
Name: Spritzee

text: When Honedge evolves, it divides into two swords, which cooperate via telepathy to coordinate attacks and slash their enemies to ribbons.
Name: Doublade

text: Apparently this Pokémon is born when a departed spirit inhabits a sword. It attaches itself to people and drinks their life force.
Name: Honedge

text: When in danger, it raises its ears and releases enough psychic power to grind a 10-ton truck into dust.
Name: Meowstic

text: The organ that emits its intense psychic power is sheltered by its ears to keep power from leaking out.
Name: Espurr

text: Trimming its fluffy fur not only makes it more elegant but also increases the swiftness of its movements.
Name: Furfrou

text: Although it possesses a violent temperament, it won’t put up with bullying. It uses the leaf in its mouth to sense the movements of its enemies.
Name: Pangoro

text: It does its best to be taken seriously by its enemies, but its glare is not sufficiently intimidating. Chewing on a leaf is its trademark.
Name: Pancham

text: It can tell how its Trainer is feeling by subtle shifts in the grip on its horns. This empathic sense lets them run as if one being.
Name: Gogoat

text: Thought to be one of the first Pokémon to live in harmony with humans, it has a placid disposition.
Name: Skiddo

text: It claims exquisite flower gardens as its territory, and it obtains power from basking in the energy emitted by flowering plants.
Name: Florges

text: It flutters around fields of flowers and cares for flowers that are starting to wilt. It draws out the hidden power of flowers to battle.
Name: Floette

text: It draws out and controls the hidden power of flowers. The flower Flabébé holds is most likely part of its body.
Name: Flabébé

text: The male with the largest mane of fire is the leader of the pride.
Name: Pyroar

text: The stronger the opponent it faces, the more heat surges from its mane and the more power flows through its body.
Name: Litleo

text: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.
Name: Vivillon

text: It lives hidden within thicket shadows. When predators attack, it quickly bristles the fur covering its body in an effort to threaten them.
Name: Spewpa

text: When under attack from bird Pokémon, it spews a poisonous black powder that causes paralysis on contact.
Name: Scatterbug

text: In the fever of an exciting battle, it showers embers from the gaps between its feathers and takes to the air.
Name: Talonflame

text: From its beak, it expels embers that set the tall grass on fire. Then it pounces on the bewildered prey that pop out of the grass.
Name: Fletchinder

text: These friendly Pokémon send signals to one another with beautiful chirps and tail-feather movements.
Name: Fletchling

text: With their powerful ears, they can heft boulders of a ton or more with ease. They can be a big help at construction sites.
Name: Diggersby

text: They use their large ears to dig burrows. They will dig the whole night through.
Name: Bunnelby

text: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.
Name: Greninja

text: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.
Name: Frogadier

text: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.
Name: Froakie

text: It gazes into the flame at the tip of its branch to achieve a focused state, which allows it to see into the future.
Name: Delphox

text: It has a twig stuck in its tail. With friction from its tail fur, it sets the twig on fire and launches into battle.
Name: Braixen

text: Eating a twig fills it with energy, and its roomy ears give vent to air hotter than 390 degrees Fahrenheit.
Name: Fennekin

text: Its Tackle is forceful enough to flip a 50-ton tank. It shields its allies from danger with its own body.
Name: Chesnaught

text: It relies on its sturdy shell to deflect predators’ attacks. It counterattacks with its sharp quills.
Name: Quilladin

text: The quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.
Name: Chespin

text: Over 300 million years ago, it was feared as the strongest of hunters. It has been modified by Team Plasma.
Name: Genesect

text: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.
Name: Meloetta

text: By blasting water from its hooves, it can glide across water. It excels at using leg moves while battling.
Name: Keldeo

text: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.
Name: Kyurem

text: The energy that comes pouring from its tail increases the nutrition in the soil, making crops grow to great size.
Name: Landorus

text: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.
Name: Zekrom

text: This Pokémon appears in legends. It sends flames into the air from its tail, burning up everything around it.
Name: Reshiram

text: Countless charred remains mar the landscape of places through which Thundurus has passed.
Name: Thundurus

text: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.
Name: Tornadus

text: This Pokémon fought humans in order to protect its friends. Legends about it continue to be passed down.
Name: Virizion

text: This Pokémon came to the defense of Pokémon that had lost their homes in a war among humans.
Name: Terrakion

text: This legendary Pokémon battled against humans to protect Pokémon. Its personality is calm and composed.
Name: Cobalion

text: When volcanic ash darkened the atmosphere, it is said that Volcarona’s fire provided a replacement for the sun.
Name: Volcarona

text: This Pokémon was believed to have been born from the sun. When it evolves, its entire body is engulfed in flames.
Name: Larvesta

text: This brutal Pokémon travels the skies on its six wings. Anything that moves seems like a foe to it, triggering its attack.
Name: Hydreigon

text: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.
Name: Zweilous

text: It tends to bite everything, and it is not a picky eater. Approaching it carelessly is dangerous.
Name: Deino

text: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.
Name: Durant

text: It breathes through a hole in its tail while it burns with an internal fire. Durant is its prey.
Name: Heatmor

text: It makes a nest out of bones it finds. It grabs weakened prey in its talons and hauls it to its nest of bones.
Name: Mandibuzz

text: Its wings are too tiny to allow it to fly. As the time approaches for it to evolve, it discards the bones it was wearing.
Name: Vullaby

text: They fight for their friends without any thought about danger to themselves. One can carry a car while flying.
Name: Braviary

text: They crush berries with their talons. They bravely stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong it is.
Name: Rufflet

text: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.
Name: Bouffalant

text: It leads a group of Pawniard. It battles to become the boss, but will be driven from the group if it loses.
Name: Bisharp

text: Blades comprise this Pokémon’s entire body. If battling dulls the blades, it sharpens them on stones by the river.
Name: Pawniard

text: It flies across the sky at Mach speeds. Removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.
Name: Golurk

text: The energy that burns inside it enables it to move, but no one has yet been able to identify this energy.
Name: Golett

text: It warms its body by absorbing sunlight with its wings. When its body temperature falls, it can no longer move.
Name: Druddigon

text: It wields the fur on its arms like a whip. Its arm attacks come with such rapidity that they cannot even be seen.
Name: Mienshao

text: In fights, they dominate with onslaughts of flowing, continuous attacks. With their sharp claws, they cut enemies.
Name: Mienfoo

text: Its skin is very hard, so it is unhurt even if stepped on by sumo wrestlers. It smiles when transmitting electricity.
Name: Stunfisk

text: When its body dries out, it weakens. So, to prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in many layers of thin membrane.
Name: Accelgor

text: When attacked, it defends itself by closing the lid of its shell. It can spit a sticky, poisonous liquid.
Name: Shelmet

text: When its body temperature goes up, it turns into steam and vanishes. When its temperature lowers, it returns to ice.
Name: Cryogonal

text: It can make its breath freeze at will. Very able in the water, it swims around in northern seas and catches prey.
Name: Beartic

text: When it is not feeling well, its mucus gets watery and the power of its Ice-type moves decreases.
Name: Cubchoo

text: They are kind but can be relentless when defending territory. They challenge foes with tusks that can cut steel.
Name: Haxorus

text: Since a broken tusk will not grow back, they diligently sharpen their tusks on river rocks after they’ve been fighting.
Name: Fraxure

text: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.
Name: Axew

text: It absorbs a spirit, which it then burns. By waving the flames on its arms, it puts its foes into a hypnotic trance.
Name: Chandelure

text: This ominous Pokémon is feared. Through cities it wanders, searching for the spirits of the fallen.
Name: Lampent

text: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokémon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.
Name: Litwick

text: It can manipulate an opponent’s memory. Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three different-colored fingers.
Name: Beheeyem

text: It uses its strong psychic power to squeeze its opponent’s brain, causing unendurable headaches.
Name: Elgyem

text: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.
Name: Eelektross

text: They coil around foes and shock them with electricity-generating organs that seem simply to be circular patterns.
Name: Eelektrik

text: While one alone doesn’t have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.
Name: Tynamo

text: Its red core functions as an energy tank. It fires the charged energy through its spikes into an area.
Name: Klinklang

text: By changing the direction in which it rotates, it communicates its feelings to others. When angry, it rotates faster.
Name: Klang

text: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.
Name: Klink

text: It fights by swinging around its three spiky feelers. A hit from these steel spikes can reduce a boulder to rubble.
Name: Ferrothorn

text: When threatened, it attacks by shooting a barrage of spikes, which gives it a chance to escape by rolling away.
Name: Ferroseed

text: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.
Name: Galvantula

text: Joltik that live in cities have learned a technique for sucking electricity from the outlets in houses.
Name: Joltik

text: The special membrane enveloping Alomomola has the ability to heal wounds.
Name: Alomomola

text: The fate of the ships and crew that wander into Jellicent’s habitat: all sunken, all lost, all vanished.
Name: Jellicent

text: With its thin, veil-like arms wrapped around the body of its opponent, it sinks to the ocean floor.
Name: Frillish

text: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.
Name: Amoonguss

text: It lures people in with its Poké Ball pattern, then releases poison spores. Why it resembles a Poké Ball is unknown.
Name: Foongus

text: They fly around at high speed, striking with their pointed spears. Even when in trouble, they face opponents bravely.
Name: Escavalier

text: These mysterious Pokémon evolve when they receive electrical stimulation while they are in the same place as Shelmet.
Name: Karrablast

text: The energy made in its cheeks’ electric pouches is stored inside its membrane and released while it is gliding.
Name: Emolga

text: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck’s horns.
Name: Sawsbuck

text: The color and scent of their fur changes to match the mountain grass. When they sense hostility, they hide in the grass.
Name: Deerling

text: Swallowing large amounts of water, they make snow clouds inside their bodies and attack their foes with violent blizzards.
Name: Vanilluxe

text: Snowy mountains are this Pokémon’s habitat. During an ancient ice age, they moved to southern areas.
Name: Vanillish

text: The temperature of their breath is -58° F. They create snow crystals and make snow fall in the areas around them.
Name: Vanillite

text: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.
Name: Swanna

text: These bird Pokémon are excellent divers. They swim around in the water eating their favorite food--peat moss.
Name: Ducklett

text: When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.
Name: Reuniclus

text: Since they have two divided brains, at times they suddenly try to take two different actions at once.
Name: Duosion

text: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.
Name: Solosis

text: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.
Name: Gothitelle

text: They use hypnosis to control people and Pokémon. Tales of Gothorita leading people astray are told in every corner.
Name: Gothorita

text: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.
Name: Gothita

text: Their white fur is coated in a special oil that makes it easy for them to deflect attacks.
Name: Cinccino

text: They greet one another by rubbing each other with their tails, which are always kept well groomed and clean.
Name: Minccino

text: Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong. It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents.
Name: Zoroark

text: It changes into the forms of others to surprise them. Apparently, it often transforms into a silent child.
Name: Zorua

text: It clenches opponents with its left arm and finishes them off with foul-smelling poison gas belched from its mouth.
Name: Garbodor

text: Inhaling the gas they belch will make you sleep for a week. They prefer unsanitary places.
Name: Trubbish

text: They are intelligent and will cooperate to catch prey. From the ground, they use a running start to take flight.
Name: Archeops

text: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, they were unable to fly and moved about by hopping from one branch to another.
Name: Archen

text: They can live both in the ocean and on land. A slap from one of them is enough to open a hole in the bottom of a tanker.
Name: Carracosta

text: Restored from a fossil, this Pokémon can dive to depths beyond half a mile.
Name: Tirtouga

text: It has been said that they swallow those who get too close and turn them into mummies. They like to eat gold nuggets.
Name: Cofagrigus

text: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.
Name: Yamask

text: They never vary the route they fly, because their memories of guarding an ancient city remain steadfast.
Name: Sigilyph

text: Groups of them beat up anything that enters their territory. Each can spit acidic liquid from its mouth.
Name: Scrafty

text: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.
Name: Scraggy

text: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.
Name: Crustle

text: This Pokémon can easily melt holes in hard rocks with a liquid secreted from its mouth.
Name: Dwebble

text: It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away the bird Pokémon that prey on its flower seeds.
Name: Maractus

text: Its internal fire burns at 2,500° F, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.
Name: Darmanitan

text: When its internal fire is burning, it cannot calm down and it runs around. When the fire diminishes, it falls asleep.
Name: Darumaka

text: They never allow prey to escape. Their jaws are so powerful, they can crush the body of an automobile.
Name: Krookodile

text: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.
Name: Krokorok

text: They live buried in the sands of the desert. The sun-warmed sands prevent their body temperature from dropping.
Name: Sandile

text: Red and blue Basculin get along so poorly, they’ll start fighting instantly. These Pokémon are very hostile.
Name: Basculin

text: Even veteran Trainers face a challenge in getting its beautiful flower to bloom. This Pokémon is popular with celebrities.
Name: Lilligant

text: The leaves on its head are very bitter. Eating one of these leaves is known to refresh a tired body.
Name: Petilil

text: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.
Name: Whimsicott

text: When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from its body. The cotton serves as a decoy to distract the attacker.
Name: Cottonee

text: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.
Name: Scolipede

text: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.
Name: Whirlipede

text: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.
Name: Venipede

text: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves, using the cutters on its arms and sticky silk.
Name: Leavanny

text: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.
Name: Swadloon

text: Leavanny dress it in clothes they made for it when it hatched. It hides its head in its hood while it is sleeping.
Name: Sewaddle

text: The sound of Sawk punching boulders and trees can be heard all the way from the mountains where they train.
Name: Sawk

text: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts.
Name: Throh

text: They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps. They use vibration to hurt their opponents.
Name: Seismitoad

text: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, they can make waves in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.
Name: Palpitoad

text: They warn others of danger by vibrating their cheeks to create a high-pitched sound.
Name: Tympole

text: It is thought that Conkeldurr taught humans how to make concrete more than 2,000 years ago.
Name: Conkeldurr

text: This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.
Name: Gurdurr

text: It fights by swinging a piece of lumber around. It is close to evolving when it can handle the lumber without difficulty.
Name: Timburr

text: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.
Name: Audino

text: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.
Name: Excadrill

text: It can dig through the ground at a speed of 30 mph. It could give a car running aboveground a good race.
Name: Drilbur

text: It emits sound waves of various frequencies from its nose, including some powerful enough to destroy rocks.
Name: Swoobat

text: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.
Name: Woobat

text: Compressing the energy from its internal core lets it fire off an attack capable of blowing away a mountain.
Name: Gigalith

text: When it overflows with power, the orange crystal on its body glows. It looks for underground water in caves.
Name: Boldore

text: Its ear is hexagonal in shape. Compressed underground, its body is as hard as steel.
Name: Roggenrola

text: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.
Name: Zebstrika

text: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use their flashing manes to communicate with one another.
Name: Blitzle

text: Males swing their head plumage to threaten opponents. The females’ flying abilities surpass those of the males.
Name: Unfezant

text: It can return to its Trainer’s location regardless of the distance separating them.
Name: Tranquill

text: Each follows its Trainer’s orders as best it can, but they sometimes fail to understand complicated commands.
Name: Pidove

text: The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and Pokémon.
Name: Musharna

text: Munna always float in the air. People whose dreams are eaten by them forget what the dreams had been about.
Name: Munna

text: The tuft on its head holds water. When the level runs low, it replenishes the tuft by siphoning up water with its tail.
Name: Simipour

text: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.
Name: Panpour

text: It loves sweets because they become energy for the fire burning inside its body.
Name: Simisear

text: When it is angered, the temperature of its head tuft reaches 600° F. It uses its tuft to roast berries.
Name: Pansear

text: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.
Name: Simisage

text: This Pokémon dwells deep in the forest. Eating a leaf from its head whisks weariness away as if by magic.
Name: Pansage

text: They steal from people for fun, but their victims can’t help but forgive them. Their deceptively cute act is perfect.
Name: Purrloin

text: These Pokémon vanish and appear unexpectedly. Many Trainers are drawn to their beautiful form and fur.
Name: Liepard

text: It rescues people stranded by blizzards in the mountains. Its shaggy fur shields it from the cold.
Name: Stoutland

text: It has black, cape-like fur that is very hard and decreases the amount of damage it receives.
Name: Herdier

text: It faces strong opponents with great courage. But, when at a disadvantage in a fight, this intelligent Pokémon flees.
Name: Lillipup

text: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.
Name: Watchog

text: Using food stored in cheek pouches, they can keep watch for days. They use their tails to communicate with others.
Name: Patrat

text: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.
Name: Samurott

text: Strict training is how it learns its flowing double-scalchop technique.
Name: Dewott

text: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.
Name: Oshawott

text: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.
Name: Emboar

text: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.
Name: Pignite

text: It can deftly dodge its foe’s attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.
Name: Tepig

text: It can stop its opponents’ movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.
Name: Serperior

text: It moves along the ground as if sliding. Its swift movements befuddle its foes, and it then attacks with a vine whip.
Name: Servine

text: It is very intelligent and calm. Being exposed to lots of sunlight makes its movements swifter.
Name: Snivy

text: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.
Name: Victini

text: It is described in mythology as the Pokémon that shaped the universe with its 1,000 arms.
Name: Arceus

text: It lives in flower patches and avoids detection by curling up to look like a flowering plant.
Name: Shaymin

text: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.
Name: Darkrai

text: Born on a cold seafloor, it will swim great distances to return to its birthplace.
Name: Manaphy

text: A Pokémon that lives in warm seas. It inflates the flotation sac on its head to drift and search for food.
Name: Phione

text: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.
Name: Cresselia

text: A Pokémon that is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours. It appears in an ancient cemetery.
Name: Giratina

text: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.
Name: Regigigas

text: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.
Name: Heatran

text: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.
Name: Palkia

text: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.
Name: Dialga

text: Known as “The Being of Willpower.” It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.
Name: Azelf

text: Known as “The Being of Emotion.” It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.
Name: Mesprit

text: Known as “The Being of Knowledge.” It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.
Name: Uxie

text: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.
Name: Rotom

text: It freezes foes with an icy breath nearly -60 degrees F. What seems to be its body is actually hollow.
Name: Froslass

text: It exudes strong magnetism from all over. It controls three small units called Mini-Noses.
Name: Probopass

text: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.
Name: Dusknoir

text: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using extending swords on its elbows.
Name: Gallade

text: Additional software was installed to make it a better Pokémon. It began acting oddly, however.
Name: Porygon-Z

text: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.
Name: Mamoswine

text: If it succeeds in catching even a faint breeze properly, it can circle the globe without flapping once.
Name: Gliscor

text: As a protective technique, it can completely freeze its fur to make its hairs stand like needles.
Name: Glaceon

text: Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air.
Name: Leafeon

text: By churning its wings, it creates shock waves that inflict critical internal injuries to foes.
Name: Yanmega

text: It will never appear where there is strife. Its sightings have become rare recently.
Name: Togekiss

text: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees F from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.
Name: Magmortar

text: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power.
Name: Electivire

text: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.
Name: Tangrowth

text: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. GEODUDE are shot at rare times.
Name: Rhyperior

text: It wraps things with its extensible tongue. Getting too close to it will leave you soaked with drool.
Name: Lickilicky

text: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.
Name: Magnezone

text: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.
Name: Weavile

text: It whips up blizzards in mountains that are always buried in snow. It is the abominable snowman.
Name: Abomasnow

text: It lives on snowy mountains. Having had little contact with humans, it is boldly inquisitive.
Name: Snover

text: A friendly Pokémon that captures the subtle flows of seawater using its two antennae.
Name: Mantyke

text: It lives on the deep-sea floor. It attracts prey by flashing the patterns on its four tail fins.
Name: Lumineon

text: After long exposure to sunlight, the patterns on its tail fins shine vividly when darkness arrives.
Name: Finneon

text: It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.
Name: Carnivine

text: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.
Name: Toxicroak

text: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.
Name: Croagunk

text: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.
Name: Drapion

text: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.
Name: Skorupi

text: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.
Name: Hippowdon

text: It lives in arid places. Instead of perspiration, it expels grainy sand from its body.
Name: Hippopotas

text: It has the ability to sense the auras of all things. It understands human speech.
Name: Lucario

text: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.
Name: Riolu

text: It wolfs down its weight in food once a day, swallowing food whole with almost no chewing.
Name: Munchlax

text: When it folds up its body and extends its wings, it looks like a jet plane. It flies at sonic speed.
Name: Garchomp

text: There is a long-held belief that medicine made from its scales will heal even incurable illnesses.
Name: Gabite

text: It nests in small, horizontal holes in cave walls. It pounces to catch prey that stray too close.
Name: Gible

text: A Pokémon that was formed by 108 spirits. It is bound to a fissure in an odd keystone.
Name: Spiritomb

text: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.
Name: Chatot

text: It loves round white things. It carries an egg-shaped rock in imitation of CHANSEY.
Name: Happiny

text: It habitually mimics foes. Once mimicked, the foe cannot take its eyes off this Pokémon.
Name: Mime Jr.

text: It looks as if it is always crying. It is actually adjusting its body’s fluid levels by eliminating excess.
Name: Bonsly

text: One caused a news sensation when it was dug up at a construction site after a 2,000-year sleep.
Name: Bronzong

text: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.
Name: Bronzor

text: It sprays a vile-smelling fluid from the tip of its tail to attack. Its range is over 160 feet.
Name: Skuntank

text: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.
Name: Stunky

text: It emits cries by agitating an orb at the back of its throat. It moves with flouncing hops.
Name: Chingling

text: It is a brazen brute that barges its way into another Pokémon’s nest and claims it as its own.
Name: Purugly

text: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness is very popular among some.
Name: Glameow

text: Becoming active at night, it is known to swarm with numerous MURKROW in tow.
Name: Honchkrow

text: Its cries sound like incantations. Those hearing it are tormented by headaches and hallucinations.
Name: Mismagius

text: An extremely cautious Pokémon. It cloaks its body with its fluffy ear fur when it senses danger.
Name: Lopunny

text: It slams foes by sharply uncoiling its rolled ears. It stings enough to make a grown-up cry in pain.
Name: Buneary

text: It’s drowzy in daytime, but flies off in the evening in big groups. No one knows where they go.
Name: Drifblim

text: A Pokémon formed by the spirits of people and Pokémon. It loves damp, humid seasons.
Name: Drifloon

text: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.
Name: Ambipom

text: It has a pliable body without any bones. If any part of its body is torn off, it grows right back.
Name: Gastrodon

text: Its colors and shapes differ from region to region. In the Sinnoh region, two types are confirmed.
Name: Shellos

text: It blooms during times of strong sunlight. It tries to make up for everything it endured as a bud.
Name: Cherrim

text: The small ball holds the nutrients needed for evolution. Apparently, it is very sweet and tasty.
Name: Cherubi

text: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.
Name: Floatzel

text: It has a flotation sac that is like an inflatable collar. It floats on water with its head out.
Name: Buizel

text: It makes fur balls that crackle with static electricity. It stores them with berries in tree holes.
Name: Pachirisu

text: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by COMBEE.
Name: Vespiquen

text: A Pokémon formed by three others. It busily carries sweet floral honey to VESPIQUEN.
Name: Combee

text: It loves the honey of flowers and steals honey collected by COMBEE.
Name: Mothim

text: When BURMY evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon’s body. The cloak is never shed.
Name: Wormadam

text: To shelter itself from cold, wintry winds, it covers itself with a cloak made of twigs and leaves.
Name: Burmy

text: Any frontal attack is repulsed. It is a docile Pokémon that feeds on grass and berries.
Name: Bastiodon

text: A Pokémon that lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its facial hide is extremely hard.
Name: Shieldon

text: Its powerful head butt has enough power to shatter even the most durable things upon impact.
Name: Rampardos

text: It lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its skull is as hard as iron.
Name: Cranidos

text: It attracts prey with a sweet aroma, then downs it with thorny whips hidden in its arms.
Name: Roserade

text: Over the winter, it closes its bud and endures the cold. In spring, the bud opens and releases pollen.
Name: Budew

text: It has eyes that can see through anything. It spots and captures prey hiding behind objects.
Name: Luxray

text: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause fainting. They live in small groups.
Name: Luxio

text: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.
Name: Shinx

text: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.
Name: Kricketune

text: It shakes its head back to front, causing its antennae to hit each other and sound like a xylophone.
Name: Kricketot

text: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.
Name: Bibarel

text: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.
Name: Bidoof

text: It has a savage nature. It will courageously challenge foes that are much larger.
Name: Staraptor

text: It flies around forests and fields in search of bug Pokémon. It stays within a huge flock.
Name: Staravia

text: They flock in great numbers. Though small, they flap their wings with great power.
Name: Starly

text: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.
Name: Empoleon

text: It lives alone, away from others. Apparently, every one of them believes it is the most important.
Name: Prinplup

text: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.
Name: Piplup

text: It uses a special kind of martial arts involving all its limbs. Its fire never goes out.
Name: Infernape

text: To intimidate attackers, it stretches the fire on its tail to make itself appear bigger.
Name: Monferno

text: It agilely scales sheer cliffs to live atop craggy mountains. Its fire is put out when it sleeps.
Name: Chimchar

text: Small Pokémon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.
Name: Torterra

text: It lives along water in forests. In the daytime, it leaves the forest to sunbathe its treed shell.
Name: Grotle

text: Made from soil, the shell on its back hardens when it drinks water. It lives along lakes.
Name: Turtwig

text: The DNA of a space virus underwent a sudden mutation upon exposure to a laser beam and resulted in DEOXYS. The crystalline organ on this POKéMON’s chest appears to be its brain.
Name: Deoxys

text: A legend states that JIRACHI will make true any wish that is written on notes attached to its head when it awakens. If this POKéMON senses danger, it will fight without awakening.
Name: Jirachi

text: RAYQUAZA lived for hundreds of millions of years in the earth’s ozone layer, never descending to the ground. This POKéMON appears to feed on water and particles in the atmosphere.
Name: Rayquaza

text: GROUDON has long been described in mythology as the POKéMON that raised lands and expanded continents. This POKéMON took to sleep after a cataclysmic battle with KYOGRE.
Name: Groudon

text: KYOGRE has the power to create massive rain clouds that cover the entire sky and bring about torrential downpours. This POKéMON saved people who were suffering from droughts.
Name: Kyogre

text: LATIOS has the ability to make its foe see an image of what it has seen or imagines in its head. This POKéMON is intelligent and understands human speech.
Name: Latios

text: LATIAS is highly sensitive to the emotions of people. If it senses any hostility, this POKéMON ruffles the feathers all over its body and cries shrilly to intimidate the foe.
Name: Latias

text: REGISTEEL has a body that is harder than any kind of metal. Its body is apparently hollow. No one has any idea what this POKéMON eats.
Name: Registeel

text: REGICE’s body was made during an ice age. The deep-frozen body can’t be melted, even by fire. This POKéMON controls frigid air of minus 328 degrees F.
Name: Regice

text: REGIROCK was sealed away by people long ago. If this POKéMON’s body is damaged in battle, it is said to seek out suitable rocks on its own to repair itself.
Name: Regirock

text: METAGROSS has four brains in total. Combined, the four brains can breeze through difficult calculations faster than a supercomputer. This POKéMON can float in the air by tucking in its four legs.
Name: Metagross

text: When two BELDUM fuse together, METANG is formed. The brains of the BELDUM are joined by a magnetic nervous system. By linking its brains magnetically, this POKéMON generates strong psychokinetic power.
Name: Metang

text: Instead of blood, a powerful magnetic force courses throughout BELDUM’s body. This POKéMON communicates with others by sending controlled pulses of magnetism.
Name: Beldum

text: SALAMENCE came about as a result of a strong, long-held dream of growing wings. It is said that this powerful desire triggered a sudden mutation in this POKéMON’s cells, causing it to sprout its magnificent wings.
Name: Salamence

text: Inside SHELGON’s armor-like shell, cells are in the midst of transformation to create an entirely new body. This POKéMON’s shell is extremely heavy, making its movements sluggish.
Name: Shelgon

text: BAGON has a dream of one day soaring in the sky. In doomed efforts to fly, this POKéMON hurls itself off cliffs. As a result of its dives, its head has grown tough and as hard as tempered steel.
Name: Bagon

text: LUVDISC live in shallow seas in the tropics. This heart-shaped POKéMON earned its name by swimming after loving couples it spotted in the ocean’s waves.
Name: Luvdisc

text: RELICANTH is a POKéMON species that existed for a hundred million years without ever changing its form. This ancient POKéMON feeds on microscopic organisms with its toothless mouth.
Name: Relicanth

text: GOREBYSS lives in the southern seas at extreme depths. Its body is built to withstand the enormous pressure of water at incredible depths. Because of this, this POKéMON’s body is unharmed by ordinary attacks.
Name: Gorebyss

text: HUNTAIL’s presence went unnoticed by people for a long time because it lives at extreme depths in the sea. This POKéMON’s eyes can see clearly even in the murky dark depths of the ocean.
Name: Huntail

text: CLAMPERL’s sturdy shell is not only good for protection - it is also used for clamping and catching prey. A fully grown CLAMPERL’s shell will be scored with nicks and scratches all over.
Name: Clamperl

text: SEALEO has the habit of always juggling on the tip of its nose anything it sees for the first time. This POKéMON occasionally entertains itself by balancing and rolling a SPHEAL on its nose.
Name: Sealeo

text: WALREIN’s two massively developed tusks can totally shatter blocks of ice weighing ten tons with one blow. This POKéMON’s thick coat of blubber insulates it from subzero temperatures.
Name: Walrein

text: SPHEAL is much faster rolling than walking to get around. When groups of this POKéMON eat, they all clap at once to show their pleasure. Because of this, their mealtimes are noisy.
Name: Spheal

text: GLALIE has a body made of rock, which it hardens with an armor of ice. This POKéMON has the ability to freeze moisture in the atmosphere into any shape it desires.
Name: Glalie

text: SNORUNT live in regions with heavy snowfall. In seasons without snow, such as spring and summer, this POKéMON steals away to live quietly among stalactites and stalagmites deep in caverns.
Name: Snorunt

text: WYNAUT can always be seen with a big, happy smile on its face. Look at its tail to determine if it is angry. When angered, this POKéMON will be slapping the ground with its tail.
Name: Wynaut

text: Every time ABSOL appears before people, it is followed by a disaster such as an earthquake or a tidal wave. As a result, it came to be known as the disaster POKéMON.
Name: Absol

text: CHIMECHO makes its cries echo inside its hollow body. When this POKéMON becomes enraged, its cries result in ultrasonic waves that have the power to knock foes flying.
Name: Chimecho

text: The bunches of fruit around TROPIUS’s neck are very popular with children. This POKéMON loves fruit, and eats it continuously. Apparently, its love for fruit resulted in its own outgrowth of fruit.
Name: Tropius

text: DUSCLOPS’s body is completely hollow - there is nothing at all inside. It is said that its body is like a black hole. This POKéMON will absorb anything into its body, but nothing will ever come back out.
Name: Dusclops

text: DUSKULL can pass through any wall no matter how thick it may be. Once this POKéMON chooses a target, it will doggedly pursue the intended victim until the break of dawn.
Name: Duskull

text: BANETTE generates energy for laying strong curses by sticking pins into its own body. This POKéMON was originally a pitiful plush doll that was thrown away.
Name: Banette

text: SHUPPET is attracted by feelings of jealousy and vindictiveness. If someone develops strong feelings of vengeance, this POKéMON will appear in a swarm and line up beneath the eaves of that person’s home.
Name: Shuppet

text: KECLEON is capable of changing its body colors at will to blend in with its surroundings. There is one exception - this POKéMON can’t change the zigzag pattern on its belly.
Name: Kecleon

text: CASTFORM’s appearance changes with the weather. This POKéMON gained the ability to use the vast power of nature to protect its tiny body.
Name: Castform

text: MILOTIC is said to be the most beautiful of all the POKéMON. It has the power to becalm such emotions as anger and hostility to quell bitter feuding.
Name: Milotic

text: FEEBAS’s fins are ragged and tattered from the start of its life. Because of its shoddy appearance, this POKéMON is largely ignored. It is capable of living in both the sea and in rivers.
Name: Feebas

text: ARMALDO’s tough armor makes all attacks bounce off. This POKéMON’s two enormous claws can be freely extended or contracted. They have the power to punch right through a steel slab.
Name: Armaldo

text: ANORITH was regenerated from a prehistoric fossil. This primitive POKéMON once lived in warm seas. It grips its prey firmly between its two large claws.
Name: Anorith

text: CRADILY roams around the ocean floor in search of food. This POKéMON freely extends its tree trunk-like neck and captures unwary prey using its eight tentacles.
Name: Cradily

text: LILEEP became extinct approximately a hundred million years ago. This ancient POKéMON attaches itself to a rock on the seafloor and catches approaching prey using tentacles shaped like flower petals.
Name: Lileep

text: CLAYDOL are said to be dolls of mud made by primitive humans and brought to life by exposure to a mysterious ray. This POKéMON moves about while levitating.
Name: Claydol

text: BALTOY moves while spinning around on its one foot. Primitive wall paintings depicting this POKéMON living among people were discovered in some ancient ruins.
Name: Baltoy

text: CRAWDAUNT has an extremely violent nature that compels it to challenge other living things to battle. Other life-forms refuse to live in ponds inhabited by this POKéMON, making them desolate places.
Name: Crawdaunt

text: CORPHISH were originally foreign POKéMON that were imported as pets. They eventually turned up in the wild. This POKéMON is very hardy and has greatly increased its population.
Name: Corphish

text: WHISCASH is extremely territorial. Just one of these POKéMON will claim a large pond as its exclusive territory. If a foe approaches it, it thrashes about and triggers a massive earthquake.
Name: Whiscash

text: BARBOACH’s sensitive whiskers serve as a superb radar system. This POKéMON hides in mud, leaving only its two whiskers exposed while it waits for prey to come along.
Name: Barboach

text: SOLROCK is a new species of POKéMON that is said to have fallen from space. It floats in air and moves silently. In battle, this POKéMON releases intensely bright light.
Name: Solrock

text: LUNATONE was discovered at a location where a meteorite fell. As a result, some people theorize that this POKéMON came from space. However, no one has been able to prove this theory so far.
Name: Lunatone

text: SEVIPER shares a generations-long feud with ZANGOOSE. The scars on its body are evidence of vicious battles. This POKéMON attacks using its sword-edged tail.
Name: Seviper

text: Memories of battling its arch-rival SEVIPER are etched into every cell of ZANGOOSE’s body. This POKéMON adroitly dodges attacks with incredible agility.
Name: Zangoose

text: ALTARIA dances and wheels through the sky among billowing, cotton-like clouds. By singing melodies in its crystal-clear voice, this POKéMON makes its listeners experience dreamy wonderment.
Name: Altaria

text: SWABLU has light and fluffy wings that are like cottony clouds. This POKéMON is not frightened of people. It lands on the heads of people and sits there like a cotton-fluff hat.
Name: Swablu

text: During the daytime, CACTURNE remains unmoving so that it does not lose any moisture to the harsh desert sun. This POKéMON becomes active at night when the temperature drops.
Name: Cacturne

text: CACNEA lives in arid locations such as deserts. It releases a strong aroma from its flower to attract prey. When prey comes near, this POKéMON shoots sharp thorns from its body to bring the victim down.
Name: Cacnea

text: FLYGON is nicknamed “the elemental spirit of the desert.” Because its flapping wings whip up a cloud of sand, this POKéMON is always enveloped in a sandstorm while flying.
Name: Flygon

text: To make prey faint, VIBRAVA generates ultrasonic waves by vigorously making its two wings vibrate. This POKéMON’s ultrasonic waves are so powerful, they can bring on headaches in people.
Name: Vibrava

text: TRAPINCH’s nest is a sloped, bowl-like pit dug in sand. This POKéMON patiently waits for prey to tumble down the pit. Its giant jaws have enough strength to crush even boulders.
Name: Trapinch

text: All the SPINDA that exist in the world are said to have utterly unique spot patterns. The shaky, tottering steps of this POKéMON give it the appearance of dancing.
Name: Spinda

text: GRUMPIG uses the black pearls on its body to amplify its psychic power waves for gaining total control over its foe. When this POKéMON uses its special power, its snorting breath grows labored.
Name: Grumpig

text: SPOINK bounces around on its tail. The shock of its bouncing makes its heart pump. As a result, this POKéMON cannot afford to stop bouncing - if it stops, its heart will stop.
Name: Spoink

text: TORKOAL digs through mountains in search of coal. If it finds some, it fills hollow spaces on its shell with the coal and burns it. If it is attacked, this POKéMON spouts thick black smoke to beat a retreat.
Name: Torkoal

text: CAMERUPT has a volcano inside its body. Magma of 18,000 degrees F courses through its body. Occasionally, the humps on this POKéMON’s back erupt, spewing the superheated magma.
Name: Camerupt

text: NUMEL is extremely dull witted - it doesn’t notice being hit. However, it can’t stand hunger for even a second. This POKéMON’s body is a seething cauldron of boiling magma.
Name: Numel

text: WAILORD is the largest of all identified POKéMON up to now. This giant POKéMON swims languorously in the vast open sea, eating massive amounts of food at once with its enormous mouth.
Name: Wailord

text: WAILMER’s nostrils are located above its eyes. This playful POKéMON loves to startle people by forcefully snorting out seawater it stores inside its body out of its nostrils.
Name: Wailmer

text: Nicknamed “the bully of the sea,” SHARPEDO is widely feared. Its cruel fangs grow back immediately if they snap off. Just one of these POKéMON can thoroughly tear apart a supertanker.
Name: Sharpedo

text: CARVANHA’s strongly developed jaws and its sharply pointed fangs pack the destructive power to rip out boat hulls. Many boats have been attacked and sunk by this POKéMON.
Name: Carvanha

text: When SWALOT spots prey, it spurts out a hideously toxic fluid from its pores and sprays the target. Once the prey has weakened, this POKéMON gulps it down whole with its cavernous mouth.
Name: Swalot

text: Virtually all of GULPIN’s body is its stomach. As a result, it can swallow something its own size. This POKéMON’s stomach contains a special fluid that digests anything.
Name: Gulpin

text: ROSELIA shoots sharp thorns as projectiles at any opponent that tries to steal the flowers on its arms. The aroma of this POKéMON brings serenity to living things.
Name: Roselia

text: ILLUMISE attracts a swarm of VOLBEAT using a sweet fragrance. Once the VOLBEAT have gathered, this POKéMON leads the lit-up swarm in drawing geometric designs on the canvas of the night sky.
Name: Illumise

text: With the arrival of night, VOLBEAT emits light from its tail. It communicates with others by adjusting the intensity and flashing of its light. This POKéMON is attracted by the sweet aroma of ILLUMISE.
Name: Volbeat

text: MINUN is more concerned about cheering on its partners than its own safety. It shorts out the electricity in its body to create brilliant showers of sparks to cheer on its teammates.
Name: Minun

text: PLUSLE always acts as a cheerleader for its partners. Whenever a teammate puts out a good effort in battle, this POKéMON shorts out its body to create the crackling noises of sparks to show its joy.
Name: Plusle

text: MANECTRIC is constantly discharging electricity from its mane. The sparks sometimes ignite forest fires. When it enters a battle, this POKéMON creates thunderclouds.
Name: Manectric

text: ELECTRIKE stores electricity in its long body hair. This POKéMON stimulates its leg muscles with electric charges. These jolts of power give its legs explosive acceleration performance.
Name: Electrike

text: It is said that through meditation, MEDICHAM heightens energy inside its body and sharpens its sixth sense. This POKéMON hides its presence by merging itself with fields and mountains.
Name: Medicham

text: MEDITITE undertakes rigorous mental training deep in the mountains. However, whenever it meditates, this POKéMON always loses its concentration and focus. As a result, its training never ends.
Name: Meditite

text: AGGRON claims an entire mountain as its own territory. It mercilessly beats up anything that violates its environment. This POKéMON vigilantly patrols its territory at all times.
Name: Aggron

text: LAIRON tempers its steel body by drinking highly nutritious mineral springwater until it is bloated. This POKéMON makes its nest close to springs of delicious water.
Name: Lairon

text: This POKéMON has a body of steel. To make its body, ARON feeds on iron ore that it digs from mountains. Occasionally, it causes major trouble by eating bridges and rails.
Name: Aron

text: MAWILE’s huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed. Its docile-looking face serves to lull its foe into letting down its guard. When the foe least expects it, MAWILE chomps it with its gaping jaws.
Name: Mawile

text: SABLEYE lead quiet lives deep inside caverns. They are feared, however, because these POKéMON are thought to steal the spirits of people when their eyes burn with a sinister glow in the darkness.
Name: Sableye

text: DELCATTY prefers to live an unfettered existence in which it can do as it pleases at its own pace. Because this POKéMON eats and sleeps whenever it decides, its daily routines are completely random.
Name: Delcatty

text: SKITTY has the habit of becoming fascinated by moving objects and chasing them around. This POKéMON is known to chase after its own tail and become dizzy.
Name: Skitty

text: NOSEPASS’s magnetic nose is always pointed to the north. If two of these POKéMON meet, they cannot turn their faces to each other when they are close because their magnetic noses repel one another.
Name: Nosepass

text: AZURILL spins its tail as if it were a lasso, then hurls it far. The momentum of the throw sends its body flying, too. Using this unique action, one of these POKéMON managed to hurl itself a record 33 feet.
Name: Azurill

text: HARIYAMA practices its straight-arm slaps in any number of locations. One hit of this POKéMON’s powerful, openhanded, straight-arm punches could snap a telephone pole in two.
Name: Hariyama

text: MAKUHITA is tenacious - it will keep getting up and attacking its foe however many times it is knocked down. Every time it gets back up, this POKéMON stores more energy in its body for evolving.
Name: Makuhita

text: EXPLOUD triggers earthquakes with the tremors it creates by bellowing. If this POKéMON violently inhales from the ports on its body, it’s a sign that it is preparing to let loose a huge bellow.
Name: Exploud

text: LOUDRED’s bellowing can completely decimate a wood-frame house. It uses its voice to punish its foes. This POKéMON’s round ears serve as loudspeakers.
Name: Loudred

text: Normally, WHISMUR’s voice is very quiet - it is barely audible even if one is paying close attention. However, if this POKéMON senses danger, it starts crying at an earsplitting volume.
Name: Whismur

text: SHEDINJA’s hard body doesn’t move - not even a twitch. In fact, its body appears to be merely a hollow shell. It is believed that this POKéMON will steal the spirit of anyone peering into its hollow body from its back.
Name: Shedinja

text: NINJASK moves around at such a high speed that it cannot be seen, even while its crying can be clearly heard. For that reason, this POKéMON was long believed to be invisible.
Name: Ninjask

text: NINCADA lives underground for many years in complete darkness. This POKéMON absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees. It stays motionless as it waits for evolution.
Name: Nincada

text: SLAKING spends all day lying down and lolling about. It eats grass growing within its reach. If it eats all the grass it can reach, this POKéMON reluctantly moves to another spot.
Name: Slaking

text: VIGOROTH is always itching and agitated to go on a wild rampage. It simply can’t tolerate sitting still for even a minute. This POKéMON’s stress level rises if it can’t be moving constantly.
Name: Vigoroth

text: SLAKOTH lolls around for over twenty hours every day. Because it moves so little, it does not need much food. This POKéMON’s sole daily meal consists of just three leaves.
Name: Slakoth

text: BRELOOM closes in on its foe with light and sprightly footwork, then throws punches with its stretchy arms. This POKéMON’s fighting technique puts boxers to shame.
Name: Breloom

text: SHROOMISH live in damp soil in the dark depths of forests. They are often found keeping still under fallen leaves. This POKéMON feeds on compost that is made up of fallen, rotted leaves.
Name: Shroomish

text: MASQUERAIN intimidates enemies with the eyelike patterns on its antennas. This POKéMON flaps its four wings to freely fly in any direction - even sideways and backwards - as if it were a helicopter.
Name: Masquerain

text: From the tips of its feet, SURSKIT secretes an oil that enables it to walk on water as if it were skating. This POKéMON feeds on microscopic organisms in ponds and lakes.
Name: Surskit

text: GARDEVOIR has the ability to read the future. If it senses impending danger to its TRAINER, this POKéMON is said to unleash its psychokinetic energy at full power.
Name: Gardevoir

text: It is said that a KIRLIA that is exposed to the positive emotions of its TRAINER grows beautiful. This POKéMON controls psychokinetic powers with its highly developed brain.
Name: Kirlia

text: RALTS senses the emotions of people using the horns on its head. This POKéMON rarely appears before people. But when it does, it draws closer if it senses that the person has a positive disposition.
Name: Ralts

text: PELIPPER is a flying transporter that carries small POKéMON and eggs inside its massive bill. This POKéMON builds its nest on steep cliffs facing the sea.
Name: Pelipper

text: WINGULL has the habit of carrying prey and valuables in its beak and hiding them in all sorts of locations. This POKéMON rides the winds and flies as if it were skating across the sky.
Name: Wingull

text: SWELLOW flies high above our heads, making graceful arcs in the sky. This POKéMON dives at a steep angle as soon as it spots its prey. The hapless prey is tightly grasped by SWELLOW’s clawed feet, preventing escape.
Name: Swellow

text: TAILLOW courageously stands its ground against foes, however strong they may be. This gutsy POKéMON will remain defiant even after a loss. On the other hand, it cries loudly if it becomes hungry.
Name: Taillow

text: SHIFTRY is a mysterious POKéMON that is said to live atop towering trees dating back over a thousand years. It creates terrific windstorms with the fans it holds.
Name: Shiftry

text: NUZLEAF live in densely overgrown forests. They occasionally venture out of the forest to startle people. This POKéMON dislikes having its long nose pinched.
Name: Nuzleaf

text: SEEDOT attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. It sucks moisture from the tree while hanging off the branch. The more water it drinks, the glossier this POKéMON’s body becomes.
Name: Seedot

text: LUDICOLO begins dancing as soon as it hears cheerful, festive music. This POKéMON is said to appear when it hears the singing of children on hiking outings.
Name: Ludicolo

text: LOMBRE is nocturnal - it will get active after dusk. It is also a mischief-maker. When this POKéMON spots anglers, it tugs on their fishing lines from beneath the surface and enjoys their consternation.
Name: Lombre

text: LOTAD live in ponds and lakes, where they float on the surface. It grows weak if its broad leaf dies. On rare occasions, this POKéMON travels on land in search of clean water.
Name: Lotad

text: DUSTOX is instinctively drawn to light. Swarms of this POKéMON are attracted by the bright lights of cities, where they wreak havoc by stripping the leaves off roadside trees for food.
Name: Dustox

text: CASCOON makes its protective cocoon by wrapping its body entirely with a fine silk from its mouth. Once the silk goes around its body, it hardens. This POKéMON prepares for its evolution inside the cocoon.
Name: Cascoon

text: BEAUTIFLY’s favorite food is the sweet pollen of flowers. If you want to see this POKéMON, just leave a potted flower by an open window. BEAUTIFLY is sure to come looking for pollen.
Name: Beautifly
